body:
After training 41 epoch. I still got mAP `Mean Average Precision: 0.1177
` on COCO test..
Am I missing anything in the code?

issue.title: Resume training from official yolov3 weights

repository.name: yolov3
repository.description: YOLOv3 in PyTorch > ONNX > CoreML > TFLite

issue.body:
Thanks for your improvement of this YOLOv3 implementation.
I have just test the training ,got some problem .
I follow these steps.
1. load the original yolov3.weight to the model
2. train it on coco2014 with your train.py.
3.Got the following logs ,the precision is down fast from 0.5->0.1. but recall is up to 0.35.
see Screenshot here
![log](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28760530/45008052-2677b480-b033-11e8-837a-361da3b012b4.png)

4.I save the weight with precision0.2, and run the detect.py
the result like this , 
![000000000019](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28760530/44996478-b2112700-afda-11e8-9399-eec286192a96.jpg)
if I do not train,the orginal wight can get this result:
![000000000019](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28760530/45008197-d6e5b880-b033-11e8-89dc-97541686dd55.jpg)

I do not know whether I used wrong parameters or something else, lead to generation of many bbox .
could you give me some suggestion?
Thank you~

body:
I have the same result with the latest commits - very low recall, precision is fine
Maybe the reason in unimplemented loss feature: 
"TODO: Additional works needs to be done to ignore non-best anchors > 0.50 iou."
or objectness loss part became too low comparing the other loss parts?

After 200 epoch on small test dataset with 3 classes I got 0.07 recall and nearly 0.97 precision
Predictions is almost fine but with very low confidence

PS: Thank you for your work :+1:

Also when training TP is always 0 or maybe 1 sometimes..FP start with some number see below...
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11752039/46535827-73ee7800-c8a4-11e8-8622-98ec02fc6ad1.png)
And after a while it become 0 as well....
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11752039/46535888-a39d8000-c8a4-11e8-9c12-4af025457169.png)

@xiao1228 @JegernOUTT sorry guys, I'm still trying to figure out the exact loss terms to use. Small changes have huge effects. Some of the options that need testing are:

1. CE vs BCE for the classification loss.
2. Size averaging vs not size averaging all loss terms.
3. Splitting confidence into obj and noobj, or not splitting (this is what's causing the very low TPs)

The main region of the code affected is small. My main strategy is to resume training from official yolov3.pt weights and look for the loss terms that produce the best mAP after 1 epoch. In the latest commit b7d039737abdc4bbc1617504847ef1361e31e885 the mAP after 1 epoch of resumed training is about 0.50 mAP, down from 0.57 mAP with the official weights, so something is probably still not right I think.
https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/b7d039737abdc4bbc1617504847ef1361e31e885/models.py#L160-L182
@glenn-jocher Thank you Glenn, yea I resume the yolov3.pt and after 3 epochs, the precision and recall become 0.381 and 0.458..

Ok I'm going to document my test results here. These are the mAPs after 1 epoch of yolov3.pt **resumed** training. All mAPs are as produced by `test.py`:

- Official yolov3.pt mAP: **0.57**
- b7d039737abdc4bbc1617504847ef1361e31e885 baseline mAP: 0.50
- b7d039737abdc4bbc1617504847ef1361e31e885 + CE `lconf`: **0.51**
- UPDATE: b7d039737abdc4bbc1617504847ef1361e31e885 + CE `lconf` + batch_size 16: **0.5191**
- UPDATE: b7d039737abdc4bbc1617504847ef1361e31e885 + _weighted_ CE `lconf`: 0.4980
- b7d039737abdc4bbc1617504847ef1361e31e885 + `size_average = False`: 0.47
- b7d039737abdc4bbc1617504847ef1361e31e885 + `lconf` split into obj and noobj @ 0.50 `conf_thres`: 0.23
- b7d039737abdc4bbc1617504847ef1361e31e885 + `lconf` split into obj and noobj @ 0.99 `conf_thres` (I've noticed splitting usually requires much higher thresholds here): 0.45
- UPDATE: b7d039737abdc4bbc1617504847ef1361e31e885 + augmentation disabled: 0.50
- UPDATE: b7d039737abdc4bbc1617504847ef1361e31e885 + batch_size 4: 0.4588
- UPDATE: b7d039737abdc4bbc1617504847ef1361e31e885 + batch_size 16: **0.5126**
- UPDATE: b7d039737abdc4bbc1617504847ef1361e31e885 + batch_size 16x4: **0.5118**
- UPDATE: b7d039737abdc4bbc1617504847ef1361e31e885 + MSE sigmoid `w` and `h` loss: 4785
- UPDATE: b7d039737abdc4bbc1617504847ef1361e31e885 + MSE exp `w` and `h` loss: 0.5073
- UPDATE: b7d039737abdc4bbc1617504847ef1361e31e885 + trained for 2 epochs: ?

... further tests?
@glenn-jocher thanks for the update! which means CE classification loss gives a slightly better mAP compare to the rest of the changes then?

CE means `nn.CrossEntropyLoss()` for `lcls`. BCE is `nn.BCEWithLogitsLoss` for `lcls`. These two options are here:
https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/b7d039737abdc4bbc1617504847ef1361e31e885/models.py#L173-L174

The problem though is none of these changes I tried retains the 0.57 mAP at the start of the resumed epoch. I'm not sure what to do, any ideas are welcome.

Sorry I'm testing on `yolov3.pt` instead of `latest.pt`. On `latest.pt` I get very low mAP also 😞 

~~@glenn-jocher I pull your latest commit and get 56.67mAP after 1 epoch of yolov3.pt resumed.~~

Here is the Tensorboard information I recorded.

![](https://i.postimg.cc/gkdw6Css/image.png)

@glenn-jocher No luck here too.... So far I think i can get the model to overfit the training set without augmentations. As soon I use augmentations, loss kinda get stuck at some point.

Btw, I also found the augmentations you used seems to be different from the C version. So it's very possible the model might converge differently if trained from the original YoloV3 weights.

@ydixon thats interesting, I'll try disabling the HSV augmentation and then disabling the spatial augmentation as two additional tests. You are right this could have a significant impact. I'm also going to try a larger batch size (16 vs 12). Darknet may be training with a much larger batch size (64?).

@ECer23 thanks a lot for the plots! I'm going to plot the same on my end for one resumed epoch. I wish your results were correct, but I think you might accidentally be testing the same yolov3.pt to get that 56.67 mAP. After you resume for one epoch the new weights are saved in latest.pt (not yolov3.pt). The code I've been using to do these tests is here:

```bash
sudo rm -rf yolov3 && git clone https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3
cd yolov3/checkpoints
wget https://storage.googleapis.com/ultralytics/yolov3.pt
cp yolov3.pt latest.pt
cd ..
python3 train.py -img_size 416 -batch_size 12 -epochs 1 -resume 1
python3 test.py -img_size 416 -weights_path checkpoints/latest.pt -conf_thres 0.5
```
@glenn-jocher From [this cfg](https://github.com/AlexeyAB/darknet/blob/master/cfg/yolov3.cfg), batch=64, subdivision=16. Therefore, real batch size = 64 / 16 = 4.
